verses.verse: O LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H410><s%>, to whom vengeance <S%H5360><s%> belongeth; O God <S%H410><s%>, to whom vengeance <S%H5360><s%> belongeth, shew <S%H3313><s%> thyself. God: Heb. God of revenges shew: Heb. shine forth
Lift up <S%H5375><s%> thyself, thou judge <S%H8199><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%>: render <S%H7725><s%> a reward <S%H1576><s%> to the proud <S%H1343><s%>.
LORD <S%H3068><s%>, how long shall the wicked <S%H7563><s%>, how long shall the wicked <S%H7563><s%> triumph <S%H5937><s%>?
How long shall they utter <S%H5042><s%> and speak <S%H1696><s%> hard things <S%H6277><s%>? and all the workers <S%H6466><s%> of iniquity <S%H205><s%> boast <S%H559><s%> themselves?
They break in pieces <S%H1792><s%> thy people <S%H5971><s%>, O LORD <S%H3068><s%>, and afflict <S%H6031><s%> thine heritage <S%H5159><s%>.
They slay <S%H2026><s%> the widow <S%H490><s%> and the stranger <S%H1616><s%>, and murder <S%H7523><s%> the fatherless <S%H3490><s%>.
Yet they say <S%H559><s%>, The LORD <S%H3050><s%> shall not see <S%H7200><s%>, neither shall the God <S%H430><s%> of Jacob <S%H3290><s%> regard <S%H995><s%> it.
Understand <S%H995><s%>, ye brutish <S%H1197><s%> among the people <S%H5971><s%>: and ye fools <S%H3684><s%>, when will ye be wise <S%H7919><s%>?
He that planted <S%H5193><s%> the ear <S%H241><s%>, shall he not hear <S%H8085><s%>? he that formed <S%H3335><s%> the eye <S%H5869><s%>, shall he not see <S%H5027><s%>?
He that chastiseth <S%H3256><s%> the heathen <S%H1471><s%>, shall not he correct <S%H3198><s%>? he that teacheth <S%H3925><s%> man <S%H120><s%> knowledge <S%H1847><s%>, shall not he know?
The LORD <S%H3068><s%> knoweth <S%H3045><s%> the thoughts <S%H4284><s%> of man <S%H120><s%>, that they are vanity <S%H1892><s%>.
Blessed <S%H835><s%> is the man <S%H1397><s%> whom thou chastenest <S%H3256><s%>, O LORD <S%H3050><s%>, and teachest <S%H3925><s%> him out of thy law <S%H8451><s%>;
That thou mayest give him rest <S%H8252><s%> from the days <S%H3117><s%> of adversity <S%H7451><s%>, until the pit <S%H7845><s%> be digged <S%H3738><s%> for the wicked <S%H7563><s%>.
For the LORD <S%H3068><s%> will not cast off <S%H5203><s%> his people <S%H5971><s%>, neither will he forsake <S%H5800><s%> his inheritance <S%H5159><s%>.

But judgment <S%H4941><s%> shall return <S%H7725><s%> unto righteousness <S%H6664><s%>: and all the upright <S%H3477><s%> in heart <S%H3820><s%> shall follow <S%H310><s%> it. shall follow: Heb. shall be after it
Who will rise up <S%H6965><s%> for me against the evildoers <S%H7489><s%>? or who will stand up <S%H3320><s%> for me against the workers <S%H6466><s%> of iniquity <S%H205><s%>?
Unless <S%H3884><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> had been my help <S%H5833><s%>, my soul <S%H5315><s%> had almost <S%H4592><s%> dwelt <S%H7931><s%> in silence <S%H1745><s%>. almost: or, quickly
When I said <S%H559><s%>, My foot <S%H7272><s%> slippeth <S%H4131><s%>; thy mercy <S%H2617><s%>, O LORD <S%H3068><s%>, held me up <S%H5582><s%>.
In the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of my thoughts <S%H8312><s%> within <S%H7130><s%> me thy comforts <S%H8575><s%> delight <S%H8173><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%>.
Shall the throne <S%H3678><s%> of iniquity <S%H1942><s%> have fellowship <S%H2266><s%> with thee, which frameth <S%H3335><s%> mischief <S%H5999><s%> by a law <S%H2706><s%>?
They gather themselves together <S%H1413><s%> against the soul <S%H5315><s%> of the righteous <S%H6662><s%>, and condemn <S%H7561><s%> the innocent <S%H5355><s%> blood <S%H1818><s%>.
But the LORD <S%H3068><s%> is my defence <S%H4869><s%>; and my God <S%H430><s%> is the rock <S%H6697><s%> of my refuge <S%H4268><s%>.

And he shall bring <S%H7725><s%> upon them their own iniquity <S%H205><s%>, and shall cut them off <S%H6789><s%> in their own wickedness <S%H7451><s%>; yea, the LORD <S%H3068><s%> our God <S%H430><s%> shall cut them off <S%H6789><s%>.
